meanings.definition: To remove or reduce sexual characteristics or qualities.
meanings.sent1: The artist desexualized the painting by covering up the revealing parts.
meanings.sent2: The movie was desexualized to make it appropriate for all audiences.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that the romance novel was desexualized by replacing all the steamy scenes with cooking recipes.
meanings.sent4: The fashion designer desexualized the outfit, turning it from provocative to elegant.
meanings.sent5: The teacher desexualized the classroom environment to ensure a comfortable learning space for all students.

meanings.definition: To make something less sexual in nature.
meanings.sent1: The company desexualized their advertisements to appeal to a wider audience.
meanings.sent2: The magazine editor decided to desexualize the cover photo to avoid controversy.
meanings.sent3: The party planner desexualized the event by choosing a theme focused on nature and animals.
meanings.sent4: The counselor helped the client desexualize their thoughts and feelings towards relationships.
meanings.sent5: The parents desexualized the conversation about intimacy to have an open and honest discussion with their child.
